item.title: IE tables problem and CSS
item.dc:creator: @elflacodepr elflacodepr
item.description:
@elflacodepr wrote:

Hello all,

I’ve been programing my web page, but I have a lil problem with the tables or CSS dont know which one, the thing is that the tables appear centered (as it should be) in Firefox, BUT when I try it with IE the tables appear in the left side.

This is the Css i made for tables:

table { margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; }

I’m not sure if this is correct, please help?

Also, I’ve made a menu on the left side of the website, and this is the code for it:

[code=css].navhead
{
background-image:url(’/img/navhead.jpg’);
color: #0099CC;
padding-left: 26px;
font-size: 16px;
}

.navbody
{
font-size: 14px;
background: #f2f2f2;
color: #F99000;
border-left: 1px solid #cbcbcb;
border-right: 1px solid #cbcbcb;
}

.navbottom
{
background-image:url(’/img/navbottom.jpg’);
}[/code]

The problem is, the picture from the bottom never appears or it does when it wants but the top appears always. I need help here too.

Thanks

Read full topic
